title: Boogie Fever
report:
Welcome back to the Jart Report after a week eleven filled with some surprise scores and a potentially shaping week as we approach the playoffs. With The Family continuing to get back on track scoring wise for Roto purposes, we are excited to dive into what was an interesting and perhaps telling week.

Week Eleven Recap

Team Ross vs United Nations:

Prediction: United Nations by 8.6

Reality: United Nations by 15.92

“Happy for MW. Big momentum for boogies night” - Aross

“I’m backkkkkkkk” - MW

I Got a Half Chubb vs Mike Williams WR1:

Prediction: I Got a Half Chubb by 25.6

Reality: I Got a Half Chubb by 30.9

“I got smacked in the mouth” - Brad

“Everyone and their motha knew I was going to beat that *female dog* Brad” - CJ

GRIDDY GANG vs CalAmari Cooper:

Prediction: CalAmari Cooper by 32.4

Reality: GRIDDY GANG by 7.94

“Proud of my boys for fighting very hard to overcome what seemed like an impossible task of beating Jonathan Taylor. Can only imagine what my team would look like if healthy” - Jase

“Tough week with Hollywood and Amari out” - Dmichs

Real Brothers vs Pray for Ridley:

Prediction: Pray for Ridley by 5.6

Reality: Real Brothers by 21.74

“I suck” - Bank

“It was a pleasure to get to take the field with my guy Bank this past week. I thought he did some good things, getting solid production from Conner and Dillon. Happy with my team’s performance this week and happy to get a much needed win as we enter the final stretch of the regular season” - Jart

Team Horses vs Team ACL Tear:

Prediction: Team Horses by 7.6

Reality: Team ACL Tear by 77.5

“I might have lost by 80, but I’m still convinced Jonah’s team sucks” - Folbe

“My team is back. Sorry to Folbisky, he's a good guy” - Lopey

NN vs Nooni:

Prediction: NN by 37.6

Reality: Nooni by 8.48

“L, season is over” - NN

“W, NN eat *poop*” - Nooni

GRIDDY GANG: 483 yards / 4 TDs = 120.8 (7th)

Nooni: 357 yards / 2 TDs = 178.5 (3rd)

Transaction Analysis

Best Transaction: Adam Trautman, $1, Aross. Though he got hurt, a solid 14.3 point outing from a streaming TE is a dream.

Honorable Mention: Chris Boswell, $0, NN. Top kicker of the week!

Worst Transaction: Wayne Gallman, $5, NN. This was a whirlwind, as NN turned around and dropped him the very next day. Considering he had one touch for -3 yards, dropping was the right move, but a confusing sequence.

Honorable Mention: Tua Tagovailoa, $6, Jart. I stand by it, but it did not work out.

Record by PF Finish

2nd: 9-2

6th: 6-5

  1. JL (144 points)

No debating.

Worst Possible Lineup

QB: Dak Prescott, 2.64 points, Dmichs (owner of the beaten dead horse)

RB: Jamaal Williams (lol), 1.1 points, Nooni

RB: D’Ernest Johnson (lol), 2.6 points, Nooni

WR: Tee Higgins, 2.5 points, Folbe (but he has more wins than hair color changes)

WR: Brandin Cooks, 2.8 points, Brad

TE: Dan Arnold, 0 points, NN

FLEX: Boston Scott, 2.8 points, Jase (trade me Kamara)

D/ST: Buffalo D/ST, -4 points, CJ

K: 3 kickers, -1 points, Jart/MW/Nooni

Total Points: 9.44

Would it have beaten Nooni: Nah, somehow he won too

Best Possible Lineup

QB: Justin Herbert, 34.28 points, MW

RB: Jonathan Taylor, 51.9 points, Dmichs

RB: Austin Ekeler, 38.5 points, JL

WR: Justin Jefferson, 33.2 points, Jase

WR: Davante Adams, 27.0 points, Jart

TE: Travis Kelce, 16.3 points, Dmichs

FLEX: Joe Mixon, 24.3 points, JL

D/ST: New England D/ST, 26.0 points, JL

K: Chris Boswell, 9.0 points, NN

Total Points: 260.48

Would it have beaten Dwitt in 2019: Easily, by far best week yet

Best Benchwarmer Lineup

QB: Jalen Hurts, 30.78 points, Jart (shut up)

RB: Devonta Freeman, 17.0 points, CJ

RB: Clyde Edwards-Helaire, 14.6 points, NN

WR: Elijah Moore, 25.6 points, Nooni

WR: Brandon Aiyuk, 18.0 points, Jart

TE: Rob Gronkowski, 10.1 points, JL

FLEX: Jamison Crowder, 13.4 points, Aross

D/ST: Philadelphia/Chicago D/ST, 11 points, Brad/JL

K: Greg Zurlein, 5 points, Dmichs

Total Points: 145.48

How many teams would it have beaten this week: 11, only JL scored more

Record by Max PF

In this segment, we will be looking at what everyone’s record would be if we played best ball - where the higher max PF each week (best lineup) would win the H2H matchup even if those players were on the bench. *Record tiebreaker was by Max PF possible on season*

  1. JL (10-1) No Change
  2. Jart (6-5) No Change
  3. CJ (6-5) No Change
  4. Dmichs (6-5) No Change
  5. Bank (6-5) +1 Win
  6. NN (6-5) +1 Win
  7. Aross (6-5) -1 Win
  8. Brad (5-6) +2 Wins
  9. Jason (4-7) -1 Win
  10. Folbe (4-7) -2 Wins
  11. MW (4-7) No Change
  12. Nooni (3-8) No Change

League Takes:

Agree:

-Roto gonna make the final couple weeks a fun sweat

-Roto playoff spot has made the end of the year very fun

-The race for 6th roto is lit

-Huuugggeee week for the league. Boogie joogie hoogie on the clock. Happy thanksgiving to all and to all a good night. But really just happy thanksgiving to the Black fam. I miss them

-I want more pumpkin pie

-Not relevant in the recent past but this league can’t stand by rules and it’s annoying

-League is stronger than ever

-The league rules!

Neutral:

-Alex is still a bad team, he’s losing 1st round of playoffs guaranteed

-Brad also sucks

Disagree:

-Dont care abt this league anyways, it’s my side league

Jart’s Mailbag

Mecole Hardman, Garrett Folbe, and Mark Ingram are all about to drown and you can only save one. Which one is it?

Is it bad that I actually thought about this one for a second? But obviously the answer is Garrett Folbe. Because otherwise, how would I know the updated roto standings on our favorite website? I’m not tryna do those by hand. But also, as we have come to discover, the Real Family was the whole league all along. Love you Gart <3.

With the league shifting towards a WHYDFML (what have you done for me lately) format, who needs to do something for Jart?

Absolutely incredible question. Right now, the easy answer is Ja’Marr Chase. While Saquon has yet to establish himself he has a couple weeks to prove it to me, whereas I am currently quite worried about Ja’Marr. Since his 30.1 point game, he has had 11.6, 5.8, and 11.5, without topping 50 yards receiving in any of those games. While he likely is not headed to the bench soon (although Aiyuk may press that issue), he certainly needs a big game if he wants to stay in the starting lineup moving forward.

What is your projected playoff bracket?

  1. Jonah
  2. CJ
  3. Jart
  4. Dmichs
  5. Aross
  6. NN

Who sucks worse? Nooni or Nooni?

Well Bank, I’m not sure your team has much ground to stand on currently, because well Nooni won and you didn’t. But as it pertains to your question, I’ll pick Nooni. You can decide if that was the first option or the second. If he ever decides to finally trade one of Evans/Godwin/Lockette and start Elijah Moore though I like his team a lot better.

Where will everyone be sleeping in NN’s house after Boogie?

All I care about is who is snuggling up next to NN at the end of the night. And that’s gonna be Jart. But I also foresee CJ ending up in some real random place that everyone laughs about and talks about for like a week.

Who’s buying the most drinks at boogie?

I think the best value is on JL. That guy is terrified of playing me this week. Otherwise give me NN sipping wine or something talking about how his season is over even though no one believes that for a second.

Order of league members marital status from who you think will be first all the way to last:

Ok so I don’t know that much about yall’s personal lives so this is a lot of conjecture.

  1. Bank
  2. NN
  3. Jart
  4. JL
  5. Folbe
  6. MW
  7. Aross
  8. Brad
  9. CJ
  10. Jason
  11. Nooni
  12. Dmichs

Who do you think had the worst draft looking back now?

When it comes to who had the “worst” draft, I am not going to include injuries, because that’s still a solid talent someone drafted and couldn’t have foreseen such circumstances. There are probably a fair amount of candidates, but I am left unable to decide between Bank and Nooni. For Bank, Ridley-Woods-Julio wasn’t working out even before all three have dealt with matters that have kept them off of the field. Aaron Jones was alright when healthy, but better backs went shortly after him. Not every pick was bad by any means, but only James Conner really stands out as a real good pick. For Nooni, only having one Top-26 pick certainly was a hindrance, but Allen Robinson was discussed last week as the biggest bust of the draft, and LockettE has certainly had his struggles as well. There aren’t too many redeeming qualities to the draft, outside of Gesicki, Stafford, and Chuba in the wake of McCaffrey’s injury.

How much wood would a woodchuck chuck if a woodchuck could chuck wood?

Seems like at least 2. So I'll say 3 wood.

How did I get so good looking?

It’s all in the genes. We love Anne and the OG Chris. Good hot tub sessions too.

Who is good in the NFL? Seems like all the good teams have bad losses recently.

AFC: Chiefs, Ravens, Chargers, Bills

NFC: Packers, Bucs, Cardinals, Rams

How can Nooni become a better fantasy player in this league?

I’ve mentioned this previously, but I think he would benefit greatly from consultation. He has said in the past that he doesn’t have the time to keep up with it all, and hey that’s fair, but don’t make your decisions in the dark then. Talk to someone else who is at least relatively impartial, and make sure that the decisions are the right ones. He had assembled a team to compete this year so the pieces can certainly be there for him, but he can’t let it all fall apart because of distance from the day-to-day of fantasy life and scrambling to make moves.

Worst NFL Draft First Round Pick of the Last Decade?

This was a tough one, so I went year by year for the last ten. I get thoughts of guys like Rashaad Penny, but the value between an early first round pick and late first round is so monumental that I really only focused on top 12 picks.

2012: Justin Blackmon, WR

2013: Luke Joeckel, OT

2014: Greg Robinson, OT

2015: Kevin White, WR

2016: Eli Apple, CB

2017: Solomon Thomas, DE

2018: Josh Rosen, QB

2019: Clelin Ferrell, DE

2020: Jeff Okudah, CB

2021: Jaycee Horn, CB

Of these ten, my choice is probably Kevin White. Because he has 323 yards receiving in his entire career, and was the 7th overall pick. LockettE (69th), Jamison Crowder (105th), and Stefon Diggs (146th) are the only notable WRs from this class, but White never was healthy. I’d understand picking any of these guys besides probably Okudah or Horn since they’re so young. Surtain going right after Horn is an additional big knock on his selection.

Which kicker should I pick up this week?

A lot of good options out there on the waivers this week, but if I had to choose one it would be Evan McPherson. A solid kicker all year in what should be a high scoring matchup.

Future of the Jart report in the off-season. What should we be expecting?

I’ve been giving this some more thought lately, and I think what it’ll look like is in-depth write-ups on each team’s season, in reverse of finish standings. So whoever finishes last this year will be written about first, and whoever wins the league will be last. So expect some sort of facetime interview, etc. as I get into each one. I would imagine there will be about 2 a month spread out across the offseason, so make sure to keep some of your thoughts and whatnot from the course of the season available for when I come knocking.

On To Week Twelve!

This Week’s Matchups:

Team Ross vs NN: This is probably the most intriguing matchup of the week to me, because they are two teams that both seem to need wins for different reasons. For Aross, the first round bye is certainly up for grabs right now with a number of teams only a game back, while for NN the roto hit this last week increases the need to get some wins and looking good while doing it. The loss of Michael Carter is certainly notable, while KC’s bye leaves Pollard and Meyers in the starting lineup. While I expect some waiver moves to be made, the combo of Stafford-Najee-Kupp-Diggs looks to be lethal this week. For Aross, Lamar looks like he will be back this week, and will be joined by Dalvin, Keenan, and a number of guys who have been somewhat inconsistent this year, although David Johnson could provide some valuable production at the FLEX. This is one that could definitely go either way, but I think Stafford-Kupp is too much to overcome in what should be a shootout with Green Bay. For this reason, we like NN by 9.3.

Aross: “BOL NN good win bro”

NN: “Doesn’t matter, season is over”

I Got a Half Chubb vs Pray for Ridley: With heart and soul of the team James Conner on bye, there is not a ton here to love. As of right now it is Brady, Dillon, and a lot of average guys. For CJ, the return of Chubb and DMont coupled with the emergence of Michael Pittman has this team looking quite dangerous. While it may not have the elite of the elite at any position, there are no real weaknesses on this team, and it is certainly a better roster than Bank has right now. We like I Got a Half Chubb by 21.3.

Bank: “I suck”

CJ: “Take it the 🏦 this week”

Nooni vs CalAmari Cooper: Nooni is coming of an 11th place PF win, while Dmichs looks to bounce back from a tough loss to Jason. Until Nooni scores above 80, I am not going to pick him. Too much firepower on Dmichs’ side in what should be a solid bounceback game for Dak. We like CalAmari Cooper by 27.6.

Nooni: “I’m going to find a way to win here”

Dmichs: “Nooni is no fun to play against, too much of a gimme”

Real Brothers vs Team ACL Tear: A potential preview of a playoff matchup, both teams come in off solid wins and are looking good. For JL, Ekeler-Mixon-Deebo is proving dangerous every single week, and the return of Gronk has pairs well with the emergence of Cam Newton. For Jart, No Tyreek Hill this week means either Ingram, Aiyuk, or Sanders is getting the start at FLEX this week. Both teams have a ton of firepower, but JL has shown much greater consistency every week, and for that reason we like Team ACL Tear by 17.6.

Jart: “Could see these teams combining for 300 points, or I could put up 70. Who knows. A lot of respect for what JL has done this year, excited to get to matchup again after a disappointing loss in Week One because I benched D’Andre Swift since he wasn’t starting”

JL: “Excited to go against the best this week although I don’t expect much with Kyler and 💿 out. Happy to give jart a win now so I can beat him in the finals”

Team Horses vs United Nations: Two teams trending in different directions currently, MW picked up a much needed win while Folbe continues to struggle to put up points. While the ceiling on MW’s team does seem pretty evident, Herbert-Caff-Jrob-Waller is a nice combo, and Javonte Williams should continue to improve down the stretch this season. For Folbe, Allen-Zeke-Fournette is a great combo, but the WR play has been inconsistent and disappointing to this point. There’s a lot to like from Metcalf-Waddle-Higgins-Jeudy, but they need to prove they can do it every week. Until that happens, we trust the consistency of MW’s stars, and we like United Nations by 3.6.

Folbe: “Idk who I play but I hope they can’t score more than 85 because that’s all I got”

MW: “Never seen a more perfect lineup but unsure what to do about Koo”

GRIDDY GANG vs Mike Williams WR1: Like Trey Sermon, you can’t let Jase get hot. He got hot last week. Although Tyrod Taylor is certainly an upgrade over Pat Mahomes, Rex is a lock for 30, the WRs are cooking now, and GRIDDY GANG is just too much right now. We like GRIDDY GANG by 62.5.

Brad: “I’m officially in tank mode I hope I lose to Jase”

Jase: “Thank god I'm playing Brad”

Best Player at Each Position

QB: Josh Allen, Folbe

RB: Christian McCaffrey, MW

WR: Cooper Kupp, NN

TE: Mark Andrews, CJ

D/ST: Whoever JL starts

K: Evan McPherson, FA

Family Award

In honor of a big win last week, we are giving MW the Family award for staying true to McCaffrey and waiting on his return instead of moving him even in the midst of losses. Team looks solid, and the commitment to the players has paid off.
